subject: Re: peddle Pro X brake damper
description_text:
Hi SIMSONN,

I received my peddles they have been great however  the damper on the brake
peddle makes a clicking sound when depressed when tapping the peddle and
happens also when the  peddle is pressed. It sounds like there is play
inside the damper. Someone else on the internet has the same issue.

Is this a faulty damper? I can not seem to remove the play in the damper.

Regards,
Tim

conversations.body_text: Hi Timothy Vergara,  You can apply some lubricant to the brake pedal to resolve the noise issue. If possible, you can also send us a video for inspection.

20251125_124318.mp4
<https://drive.google.com/file/d/1FOl2VSThCzLfsmrDhONEO8_nRPmveUbu/view?usp=drive_web>

Hi Service,



Yes I have lubricated all moving parts for the brake, clutch and acc peddle.

As per the attached video, there is definitely play in the damper, as the
sound still exists with the elastomers removed.


Also the clutch makes a clicking sound which I have not resolved but only
happens in the initial phase when pressed as per the video

But the brake clunks at all positions of the brake travel. Its sounds like
a mechanical keyboard every time I press the brakes,


Regards,

Tim Vergara



*

Hi Timothy Vergara,     When reinstalling the 8-level adjustable hydraulic lever for the brake, make sure to apply some pressure to the lever while tightening the two large nuts to prevent loosening. If the clutch preload is insufficient, you can replace the spring with a red or blue one, or apply sufficient pressure when tightening the preload nut to resolve any looseness.
